snippet: The announcement was a forthright acknowledgment by the Vatican of an enduring problem, and fit with Pope Francis’ pattern of willingness to set a new tone in the governance of the church.
abstract: Vatican announces that Pope Francis will establish a commission to advise him on protecting children from pedophile priests and how to counsel victims; move is first concrete step by Francis to address the clerical sexual-abuse problem in the Roman Catholic Church.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO, ALAN COWELL and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Vatican City, Alan Cowell from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from Salt Lake City.

lead_paragraph: The announcement was a forthright acknowledgment by the Vatican of an enduring problem, and fit with Pope Francis’ pattern of willingness to set a new tone in the governance of the church.

headline.main: Pope Setting Up Commission on the Sexual Abuse of Children by Priests
